medical_history.chief_complaint: The child was noted to have a right-sided facial palsy at birth, with additional concerns later raised about the left side.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The right-sided facial palsy was noted at birth, and concerns about the left side arose later. The child exhibited anomalies in the left upper limb and experienced an episode of milk aspiration requiring admission to the neonatal intensive care unit for 20 days. Oral intake was poorly coordinated and required support via a nasogastric tube. He underwent a release of web space syndactyly at 18 months of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The prenatal history was uneventful and there was no maternal history of medical or recreational drug use. Additionally, echocardiography revealed a patent ductus arteriosus and a moderate atrial septal defect, which was treated expectantly. A genetic workup identified two variants in the PLXND1 gene.
medical_history.family_history: The child's mother does not exhibit Poland-MÃ¶bius syndrome.
